Fun fact: Vayne's stealth lasts a maximum of 1 second
This means that in order to proc duskblade she has to wait until her stealth is up and cannot auto earlier. This means that by going for a duskblade, she's losing out on a potential 1-2 autos late game during the time she's waiting if she's full build as you're insinuating...

This. It actually drops your DPS compared to normal builds.
It's like Jinx using Zap! in late-game teamfights.

1600 (maximum) additional damage for 5 seconds of additional wait time in a fight/skirmish. Absolutely not worthwhile.
This is what I was looking for when I googled this question. Thank you for maths.
Let's imagine anybody using that build so they lose pretty much all their dps.

Yeah you lose so much DPS building IE and shiv and building attack speed on a champ that deals %hp true damage every 3 attacks

Oh wait.

The thing is that you will not be able to get 5 procs off on Vayne
You can cancel Vayne's stealth early by autoattacking before it ends, which will make the stealth last only about 0.6 seconds instead of 1 second, meaning she has to wait for the stealth to end before she can auto attack

Many good Vayne players make use of the short invisibility provided by her tumble to keep moving rather than auto attacking and breaking it.  The ability to move around and keep the enemy team guessing where you are is one of the reasons you see Vayne 1v5 where other ADC would just get CC to death.
Imagine if next patch: Duskblade's bonus damage can now apply critical strikes and lifesteal

Dude, people have already tried this in the past when Duskblade had a similar effect. A little more than half the time it just isn't worth waiting the full one second of stealth to proc it and results in a net DPS drop. Sure, in certain situations, it would be the better play. But most of the time it's a DPS loss. It might even be a viable pick on Vayne for a few procs in a fight, but not in the way you are stating to use it.

i imagine the purpose would be to get the ball rolling by rushing it for early trades in lane, when the extra ~140 damage is worth the time you aren't AAing along with the overall increase in damage from the lethality and slight increase in tumbles from CDR.

or just nerf Vaynes maximum stealth duration to 0,95 sec.

would already do the job.

I've been away for a bit, but last I checked maximizing duskblade procs gutted her DPS.
Sure, she has an increased chance of "1-shotting" squishies (which she already does); but anyone with a bit of durability will survive longer. Overall a net-loss.
Sure dps would be lower, but vs squishies, reliable burst is extremely helpful, especially with the safety invis brings to the table

My point is, Crit tumbles already give her reliable burst. she "1-shots" squishies without dusblade. The trade-off for increased 1-shot potential is dropping her DPS through the floor.
Doesn't seem worth it to me.

you're calling crit reliable lol. RNG is not reliable man. maybe if she's got 100% crit. Also, recently teams opt for pretty damn squish champs. 5 duskblade 1 shots vs 5 squishies sounds like an ez penta to me
Duskblade needs more than a one second cooldown, even 5-10 seconds would still make it a great item, and more so for junglers and assassins for which it was intended.
Vayne is completely worthless right now. If she rushes duskblade, then you won

Vayne counters {{champion:141}} , {{champion:31}} , {{champion:58}} , and {{champion:154}} , some of the most durability focused champions in the current meta, saying that she's worthless at any point if a great joke since you clearly don't understand how valuable Vayne can be. She doesn't need to rush duskblade, but it still easily gives her high burst potential after only a few hits. You have a passive ability that deal % Max HP true damage, and duskblade is just icing on the cake she can build as a second item after whatever she feels necessary as a crit first buy. She can rush it too since its such a mathematically low cost item like her other items for ADCs, and becomes a more efficient rush before IE because not only are you constantly proccing true damage in fights, but the bonus reset on duskblade means you not only have extra pressure on tanks, but can drop squishies in about 3 hits similarly to other ADCs who don't have the power to rip through tanks.
